text.p: These are the leading stories in the Skopje press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified them nor does it vouch for their accuracy.

- Preliminary findings of the World Health Organisation did not disclose any evidence of infectious or toxicological causes for reports of alleged poisoning of several hundred Albanian children in the Tetovo region, the information secretariat reported Tuesday.
- Hari Kostov appointed new general manager of Macedonia's commercial bank. Kostov was Macedonia's representative in the World Bank.
- Over 400 companies from 15 countries are taking part in Skopje's fair of ferrous and non-ferrous metallurgy, electronics, construction and technology, Technoma 96.

- "There are 300,000 shareholders in Macedonia. Sooner or later they will start trading with their stocks. We shouldn't be surprised that the stock exchange works so slowly at the moment," stated Olgica Mihajlovska Markovska of the state privatisation agency. -- Mircela Casule, Skopje newsroom +389 91 201196
